page.title: 15Bell ringing in Alrewas
page.content: On a Tuesday night at 7.30 p.m. you can hear peals of bells ringing at Alrewas Church. This is the bellringers' practice night.About 11 or 12 people go,but in all there are about 20 ringers.They ring for weddings and services.A fee of one pound fifty pence is paid for weddings.The youngest ringer is 7 years old and the oldest is over 60. Most people think that bellringing is easy,just pull and pull again,but it is harder than you think.Only eight people can ring at one time because there are only eight bells.We (Nicola and Emma) are 13 years old and have been ringing for 6 months. People who are beginners are not allowed to ring on their own until they are considered competent.
